transcript.title: Extract of Interview with Peter Wilkins, ABC Radio Sport
transcript.content:
Subject: funding for Paralympics.

E&OEâ¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦â¦

WILKINS:

The Paralympics, Prime Minister, are they worth more money in terms of funding?

PRIME MINISTER:

They will get a funding increase just as weâve promised the Olympians a funding increase, weâre going to do the same for the Paralympians. Weâre not going to treat them unfairly. Weâre going to give them the same generosity that weâre going to display towards the Olympians.

WILKINS:

Has that been disclosed to them yet?

PRIME MINISTER:

I discussed it with a number of their officials yes. So, you know, if thereâs an âXâ percent rise in the Olympic funding, weâre going to try and be reasonable and fair and generous to the Paralympians as well.

WILKINS:

An yet undisclosed amount?

PRIME MINISTER:

No, as yet undisclosed but I just wanted to make it plain that we are going to be even handed.
[Ends]
